results.title: They do it with mirrors
results.creator_credit: Norman Stone, George Gallaccio, Arts and Entertainment Network and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Miss Marple Series”.
Miss Marple’s keen powers of observation and detection are put to good use at Stonygates, the rambling country house where her friend Carrie-Louise (Jean Simmons) and husband Lewis run a reformatory for young criminals. Shots are fired in a dark room but the victim is discovered elsewhere. Miss Marple soon identifies the killer. Once again, Joan Hickson plays the ever popular Miss Marple.

results.title: Fundamentals of the Nervous System
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program. Unit 4. Physiology”.
Live photography, microphotography, animated drawings and medical demonstrations illustrate the functions, diversions and specific tasks of the nervous system. Shows how it conveys information from sense organs to brain, co-ordinates information with experience and directs muscles and other organs to carry out adaptive behaviour.

results.title: No turning back
results.creator_credit: Sue Richter, Georgia Allen and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
A group of teenagers from a South Australian high school take part in the “Sharing our future” celebrations, a week of activities organised by the Office of Multicultural Affairs to celebrate the diversity of culture in Australia. By organising dance and drama performances together, and getting involved in discussions to do with what it means to be Australian, the young people come to appreciate the richness that cultural diversity has brought to their country. “No turning back” features songs by Gondwanaland and Midnight Oil and a special appearance by Jimmy Barnes.

results.title: The Bolero
results.creator_credit: William Fertik, Allan Miller and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: An exciting study of Ravel’s composition “Bolero” with the subtle meanings and accents polished to a brilliant interpretation by members of the Los Angeles Philharmonic Orchestra with Zubin Mehta. The film involves the viewer in each musician’s approach to his part in individual performance. It also gives some insight into Mehta’s perspective on musical values in the composition. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: William Fertik, Allan Miller and Pyramid Films

results.title: The Work of the kidneys. - 2nd. ed
results.creator_credit: Frank V Robinson, Charles L. Finance and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Biology program. Unit 4. Physiology”.
Examines the importance of the kidneys as regulators of the body’s internal environment. Shows the functions of the kidney’s major parts and the relationships of these parts to each other as well as describing the physiological mechanisms by which the kidneys control the volume and composition of body fluids.

results.title: Things I call mine
results.creator_credit: Mitzi Goldman, Kay Donovan and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Immigrants from a variety of backgrounds talk about the personal belongings they brought with them, why they brought those particular items and the memories they evoke. The interviews are intercut with a dramatisation of a young woman arriving in a new country and arranging her personal possessions in her room.

results.title: The Bloodhouse
results.creator_credit: Humphrey McQueen, Garry Lane and Experimental Film and Television Fund
results.brief_description: The power of big companies like BHP deeply affects our economy and environment and our way of life. The film describes the effects of highly developed capitalist industry - environmental pollution, disregard for workers conditions and the exploitation of migrant workers. The film shows conditions which helped to earn the Port Kembla steelworks the title of ‘Bloodhouse’.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Humphrey McQueen, Garry Lane and Experimental Film and Television Fund

results.title: The Ears and hearing. [Rev. ed.]
results.creator_credit: Richard Barlow, Charles L. Finance and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program. Unit 4. Physiology”.
Structure and functions of the human ear and how it transmits sound waves to the brain. Discusses hearing malfunctions and records various stages of stapendectomy while the surgeon comments on the delicate procedures.

results.title: The Bohemian girl
results.creator_credit: Charles Rogers, James W. Horne and Hal Roach
results.brief_description: A tale of gypsies who kidnap a nobleman’s daughter and bring her up as their own. When they return years later, the girl is wrongly blamed for stealing from her father’s house. Based on the operetta by Balfe, this comedy adaptation stars Stan Laurel and Oliver Hardy with Thelma Todd, Antonio Moreno, Jacqueline Wells, James Finlayson.

results.title: Buddha wish me luck
results.creator_credit: Sally Ingleton, Margaret Smith and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Erwin, a refugee from Hungary and his wife Samran, whom he met on a trip to Thailand live near Darwin. They describe their separate experiences as immigrants to Australia, their life together and the small tropical fruit farm that they own. Erwin is a loner, who likes nothing better than to go off hunting crocodiles, or fishing, but his wife Samran enjoys the human contact and busyness of the market where she sells her fruit. A tantalising glimpse into a marriage between two quite different people.
